thread.title: Massive alligator caught on camera in Polk County
thread.title_full: Massive alligator caught on camera in Polk County - Orlando Sentinel

author: orlandosentinel.com
title: Massive alligator caught on camera in Polk County

organizations.name: arnold palmer hospital for children children

text:
A massive alligator that looks a little prehistoric was caught on camera in Polk County Sunday, and the video of it is now going viral.
The Lakeland Police Department shared a video on its Facebook page of the gator strolling along at Circle B Bar Reserve, an area of protected lands in Polk near Lakeland.
The police department said in its post that Kim Joiner caught the reptile on camera. In the background of the video, you can see other brave souls filming and watching the creature as it crosses a grassy path from one bushy area to another
In comments on the Facebook post, Lakeland PD responds to a concerned commenter to assure them that the gator won’t be harmed. 
“They are quite common at Circle B,” Lakeland PD commented. 
The video is going viral, with more than 114,000 views on Facebook as of 5:15 p.m. Monday, and it’s been picked up and shared by news outlets around Florida.

Caption Last minute advice for Walt Disney World Marathon Weekend Over 50,000 runners are making final preparations for Walt Disney World Marathon Weekend. Track Shack's Chris Hughes offers Rich Pope some last minute pre-race advice on how to deal with race day jitters, when and what to eat, what to take to the corrals and even broached the taboo of running in a new pair of shoes on race day.
